isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION

svcproc.title: Back-Up Lights
svcproc.para: When the key switch (24) is moved to the start or ignition position, power is applied to circuit 13, fuse F1, circuit 71, connector (2) and one of four circuit configurations based on type of engine and transmission. Thus, when the back-up light switch contacts close, power flows through connector (2), circuit 71B, circuit 71A, connector 13, and a blue wire to the back-up lights through connector (700/701) and (702). The ground path for the back-up lights is through a white wire to the frame ground. If applicable, power is also fed from connector (182) through circuit 71C to the owner/operator junction block (J7-4) and/or to dash connector (13-A2) with frame mounted 7-way socket.
